meanings.definition: Make (something) cheaper in price or quality.
meanings.sent1: Buying items on sale often cheapens them.
meanings.sent2: Lowering the cost of a product cheapens its value.
meanings.sent3: When everything is on clearance, it cheapens the entire store.
meanings.sent4: Reducing the price of art cheapens the artist's work.
meanings.sent5: The constant discounts cheapen the brand's image.

meanings.definition: Diminish the value or worth of (something).
meanings.sent1: Using poor materials cheapens the final product.
meanings.sent2: His careless behavior cheapens the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent3: Adding too many decorations can cheapen the overall look of the room.
meanings.sent4: Her insincere apology cheapened the sincerity of her previous actions.
meanings.sent5: The fake smile cheapens the genuine happiness of the moment.
